title: AI vs. Non-AI Job Growth: Displacement or Innovation?
text:
Artificial Intelligence is reshaping the global workforce. From automation replacing clerical jobs to AI creating entirely new industries, the job market is undergoing a rapid transformation.

Who wins and who loses?

Which industries are AI-powered and which ones remain untouched?

How should job seekers adapt to this shift?

This report analyzes real-world job market data to separate hype from reality.
🔍 Key Insights:
✔ AI-driven job loss vs. job creation
✔ Salary trends: AI-powered careers vs. traditional roles
✔ Emerging job titles due to AI advancements
✔ Strategies for future-proofing careers

“The robots are coming for your jobs!”
But are they really? Let’s analyze the data.




Our findings are based on real job market data from Lightcast, the World Economic Forum, and labor market reports.
➡ Visualizations & interactive charts included!
👥 Authors: Vidhi A. Sharma, Soham Deshkhaire, Nhan (Johnny) Huynh
📅 Published: 2024
📂 GitHub Repository: Project Link







title: “Key Findings: AI vs. Non-AI Careers” format: html: toc: true number-sections: true bibliography: references.bib csl: csl/econometrica.csl —

title: AI vs. Non-AI Job Growth: Displacement or Innovation?
text:
2.1 📉 Jobs AI Is Replacing
AI-driven automation is rapidly eliminating traditional jobs across industries:
📌 Clerical & Admin Work → Data Entry Clerks, Secretaries
📌 Retail & Banking → Cashiers, Bank Tellers
📌 Customer Service → AI Chatbots replacing human agents
📌 Manufacturing → Automated assembly lines replacing factory workers

“Machines don’t call in sick, but they also don’t innovate.” – Industry Expert

title: AI vs. Non-AI Job Growth: Displacement or Innovation?
text:
2.2 📈 AI-Powered Job Growth
Despite job losses, AI is creating new career opportunities:
✔ Data Science & AI Engineering → 400% increase in job postings
✔ Cybersecurity Analysts → High demand due to AI-driven fraud risks
✔ AI Ethics & Compliance Experts → Regulatory demand is booming
✔ Healthcare AI Specialists → AI-assisted diagnostics & robotics surgery
💡 Industries experiencing AI-powered growth:
Tech, Finance, Healthcare, E-Commerce, Cybersecurity

title: AI vs. Non-AI Job Growth: Displacement or Innovation?

title: AI vs. Non-AI Job Growth: Displacement or Innovation?
text:
3.1 🚀 In-Demand Skills (2024 & Beyond)
To remain competitive, professionals must focus on AI-proof skills:
📌 Machine Learning & Data Science → AI-driven automation & analytics
📌 Cybersecurity & Ethical Hacking → Protecting AI-powered systems
📌 AI Ethics & Governance → Managing bias & compliance in AI
📌 Creativity & Human-Centered Skills → AI can’t replace emotional intelligence

title: AI vs. Non-AI Job Growth: Displacement or Innovation?
text:
3.3 📌 Resume & ATS Optimization
To beat AI-powered hiring systems, job seekers must:
✔ Use AI-friendly keywords (skills like Python, TensorFlow, NLP)
✔ Quantify achievements (e.g., “Improved AI model accuracy by 30%”)
✔ Customize applications for each job (avoid generic resumes)

“AI is choosing who gets hired – learn how to game the system.”

title: Career Strategy in the Age of AI
text:
AI is automating entire job sectors, but it’s also creating new, high-paying opportunities. Our goal? Stay ahead of AI, not behind it.




AI is great at repetitive, rule-based tasks, making some jobs vulnerable. Here’s where AI is replacing humans:

Clerical Work → AI handles data entry, secretarial tasks, office assistants

Bank Tellers & Cashiers → ATMs & mobile banking apps

Customer Service Agents → AI chatbots are answering 24/7

Retail Workers → Self-checkout kiosks & automated supply chains

Telemarketers → AI voice assistants are relentless
(Source: World Economic Forum)





Some highly human skills will always be in demand. Here’s where AI is creating new jobs:

Data Science & AI Engineering → The backbone of AI innovation

AI Ethics & Compliance → Regulating AI use & preventing bias

Healthcare AI Specialists → AI-powered diagnostics, medical data science

Cybersecurity Experts → Defending against AI-powered threats

UX & Human-Centered AI Designers → Making AI work for people

Survival Tip: If AI can’t easily replicate creativity, emotional intelligence, or strategic thinking, that’s a safe career.




AI jobs are paying 77.53% more than traditional jobs!
(Source: Visual Capitalist)



Job Role
Average Salary




AI Engineer
$160,000


Machine Learning Scientist
$150,000


Data Scientist
$140,000


Cybersecurity Analyst
$120,000


AI UX Designer
$110,000


Traditional IT Role (SysAdmin)
$80,000



If you’re not in AI-related fields yet, NOW is the time to pivot.




Did you know 75% of resumes get auto-rejected by Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS)?
(Source: UMass Career Center)


✅ Use AI-friendly Keywords → Match job descriptions EXACTLY
✅ Simple Formatting → No fancy fonts, tables, or images
✅ Job Title Tweaks → Adjust titles to fit employer expectations
✅ Skills Section Must Have: Python, SQL, AI, ML, Data Analytics
✅ Submit in PDF Format → Prevent formatting errors








Take online courses (Coursera, Udemy, Google AI)
Master Python, SQL, Machine Learning, and Prompt Engineering
Join AI hackathons (Kaggle, DrivenData)





Connect with AI recruiters on LinkedIn

Attend AI & Tech Conferences (Google I/O, NeurIPS)

Engage in GitHub Projects & showcase your work





Write AI-related articles on Medium

Create an AI Portfolio Website with Quarto

Post AI projects & research on LinkedIn









Greenhouse. (2024). Ghosting in the Hiring Process: Job Seeker Frustrations. Retrieved from CNBC
Herschberg, M. (2024). Why Companies Ghost Candidates & What To Do About It. Medium
World Economic Forum. (2023). Jobs Lost and Created by AI & GPT. Retrieved from WEF
UMass Career Center. (2024). How to Beat the ATS (Applicant Tracking System). Isenberg UMass
Visual Capitalist. (2024). AI Careers vs Traditional Jobs: Salary Insights. Retrieved from Visual Capitalist

title: Surviving the 2024 Job Market: AI, Ghosting & Paychecks
text:
Job hunting in 2024 is a rollercoaster—except it’s less “fun amusement park” and more “trapped in a Zoom call with no exit.” AI is taking jobs, recruiters are ghosting, and salary gaps are growing faster than my stress levels.
This report is for job seekers who just want answers—not generic LinkedIn advice like “just be yourself!” (We tried that, and yet here we are, still unemployed).



Is AI helping or ruining careers? (Spoiler: It depends.)
Why do recruiters ghost more than bad Tinder dates?
Who’s getting the best salaries, and is it too late to switch careers?
How do you actually beat Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS)?

Using data from Lightcast, World Economic Forum, and hiring platforms, we analyze trends and give realistic career advice. Buckle up—this might hurt, but at least it’s honest.







title: “Job Market Findings: AI, Ghosting, & Salary Drama” format: html toc: true number-sections: true bibliography: references.bib csl: csl/econometrica.csl —

title: Surviving the 2024 Job Market: AI, Ghosting & Paychecks
text: title: “Job Market Findings: AI, Ghosting, & Salary Drama” format: html toc: true number-sections: true bibliography: references.bib csl: csl/econometrica.csl —

title: Surviving the 2024 Job Market: AI, Ghosting & Paychecks
section: 2.1 1. The Ghosting Epidemic: When Recruiters Disappear
text:
2.1 1. The Ghosting Epidemic: When Recruiters Disappear
Ghosting is no longer just for dating. A 2024 survey found that 52% of job seekers never heard back after multiple interview rounds (Herschberg, 2024).

2.1.1 Why Do Companies Ghost?

Internal Chaos: Budget cuts, layoffs, or leadership playing “musical chairs.”
Recruiter Burnout: Some recruiters manage hundreds of applicants per job (so yes, your “just checking in” email is lost in the abyss).
Fake Jobs? Yep. Some listings are just for show—used to collect resumes or gauge market interest (Herschberg, 2024).



2.1.2 How to Beat the Ghosting Game

Always ask for a hiring timeline. If they don’t give one, it’s a red flag.
Follow up—but no begging. Twice is enough. After that, move on.
Network like your career depends on it (because it does). Referrals triple your chances of getting hired (Greenhouse, 2024).

title: Surviving the 2024 Job Market: AI, Ghosting & Paychecks
section: 2.2 2. AI Is Stealing Jobs (And Creating New Ones)
text:
2.2 2. AI Is Stealing Jobs (And Creating New Ones)
AI isn’t just replacing workers—it’s reshaping entire industries. The World Economic Forum predicts 85 million jobs will disappear by 2025, but 97 million new ones will emerge (WEF, 2023). So, it’s like musical chairs… but with robots.

2.2.1 Jobs Most at Risk:

Clerical/Admin: If your job involves copy-pasting all day, AI has bad news for you.
Customer Support: Chatbots are stealing jobs faster than customers can say, “I want to speak to a manager!”
Manufacturing & Retail: Self-checkouts don’t call in sick.



2.2.2 Jobs AI is Creating

AI Ethics Consultants: Someone has to stop AI from ruining everything.
Data Analysts & Scientists: AI needs humans to fix its mistakes.
Cybersecurity Experts: AI is smart, but hackers are smarter.

title: Surviving the 2024 Job Market: AI, Ghosting & Paychecks
section: 2.3 3. AI vs. Non-AI Salaries: Who’s Winning?
text:
2.3 3. AI vs. Non-AI Salaries: Who’s Winning?
Want a six-figure salary? Learn AI. AI-driven roles are paying 77.53% more than traditional jobs (Visual Capitalist, 2023).



Job Role
Average Salary (2024)




AI Research Scientist
$170,000


Machine Learning Engineer
$145,000


Cybersecurity Specialist
$130,000


Data Scientist
$120,000


Accountant
$70,000

$45,000



Takeaway: If you’re still debating a career change, now’s the time.

title: Surviving the 2024 Job Market: AI, Ghosting & Paychecks
text:
3.1 1. In-Demand Skills That Actually Matter
If you want job security, forget “teamwork” and “communication” on your resume—these skills will get you hired:

Machine Learning & AI (Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Data Science & Analytics (SQL, R, data visualization)
Cybersecurity (Cloud security, ethical hacking)
Marketing Analytics (SEO, AI-driven campaigns)
Project Management (Agile, Scrum, Jira)

How to Learn These Skills - Google Certificates (Free on Coursera) - Udemy & YouTube (Free AI courses exist!) - Build a portfolio (Hiring managers love real-world projects).

title: Surviving the 2024 Job Market: AI, Ghosting & Paychecks
text:
3.2 2. Best-Paying Job Roles in 2024
If you’re not making at least $100K, consider switching careers. Here’s where the biggest paychecks are:

text:
3.3 📌 Resume & ATS Optimization
To beat AI-powered hiring systems, job seekers must:
✔ Use AI-friendly keywords (skills like Python, TensorFlow, NLP)
✔ Quantify achievements (e.g., “Improved AI model accuracy by 30%”)
✔ Customize applications for each job (avoid generic resumes)

“AI is choosing who gets hired – learn how to game the system.”

title: Surviving the 2024 Job Market: AI, Ghosting & Paychecks
text:
Job hunting in 2024 is a rollercoaster—except it’s less “fun amusement park” and more “trapped in a Zoom call with no exit.” AI is taking jobs, recruiters are ghosting, and salary gaps are growing faster than my stress levels.
This report is for job seekers who just want answers—not generic LinkedIn advice like “just be yourself!” (We tried that, and yet here we are, still unemployed).



Is AI helping or ruining careers? (Spoiler: It depends.)
Why do recruiters ghost more than bad Tinder dates?
Who’s getting the best salaries, and is it too late to switch careers?
How do you actually beat Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS)?

Using data from Lightcast, World Economic Forum, and hiring platforms, we analyze trends and give realistic career advice. Buckle up—this might hurt, but at least it’s honest.







title: “Job Market Findings: AI, Ghosting, & Salary Drama” format: html toc: true number-sections: true bibliography: references.bib csl: csl/econometrica.csl —

title: Surviving the 2024 Job Market: AI, Ghosting & Paychecks

title: Surviving the 2024 Job Market: AI, Ghosting & Paychecks
section: 2.1 1. The Ghosting Epidemic: When Recruiters Disappear
text:
2.1 1. The Ghosting Epidemic: When Recruiters Disappear
Ghosting is no longer just for dating. A 2024 survey found that 52% of job seekers never heard back after multiple interview rounds (Herschberg, 2024).

2.1.1 Why Do Companies Ghost?

Internal Chaos: Budget cuts, layoffs, or leadership playing “musical chairs.”
Recruiter Burnout: Some recruiters manage hundreds of applicants per job (so yes, your “just checking in” email is lost in the abyss).
Fake Jobs? Yep. Some listings are just for show—used to collect resumes or gauge market interest (Herschberg, 2024).



2.1.2 How to Beat the Ghosting Game

Always ask for a hiring timeline. If they don’t give one, it’s a red flag.
Follow up—but no begging. Twice is enough. After that, move on.
Network like your career depends on it (because it does). Referrals triple your chances of getting hired (Greenhouse, 2024).

title: Surviving the 2024 Job Market: AI, Ghosting & Paychecks
section: 2.2 2. AI Is Stealing Jobs (And Creating New Ones)
text:
2.2 2. AI Is Stealing Jobs (And Creating New Ones)
AI isn’t just replacing workers—it’s reshaping entire industries. The World Economic Forum predicts 85 million jobs will disappear by 2025, but 97 million new ones will emerge (WEF, 2023). So, it’s like musical chairs… but with robots.

2.2.1 Jobs Most at Risk:

Clerical/Admin: If your job involves copy-pasting all day, AI has bad news for you.
Customer Support: Chatbots are stealing jobs faster than customers can say, “I want to speak to a manager!”
Manufacturing & Retail: Self-checkouts don’t call in sick.



2.2.2 Jobs AI is Creating

AI Ethics Consultants: Someone has to stop AI from ruining everything.
Data Analysts & Scientists: AI needs humans to fix its mistakes.
Cybersecurity Experts: AI is smart, but hackers are smarter.

title: Surviving the 2024 Job Market: AI, Ghosting & Paychecks
text:
3.1 1. In-Demand Skills That Actually Matter
If you want job security, forget “teamwork” and “communication” on your resume—these skills will get you hired:

Machine Learning & AI (Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Data Science & Analytics (SQL, R, data visualization)
Cybersecurity (Cloud security, ethical hacking)
Marketing Analytics (SEO, AI-driven campaigns)
Project Management (Agile, Scrum, Jira)

How to Learn These Skills - Google Certificates (Free on Coursera) - Udemy & YouTube (Free AI courses exist!) - Build a portfolio (Hiring managers love real-world projects).

title: AI vs. Non-AI Job Growth: Is AI Taking Over or Creating More Jobs?
text:
The debate on whether AI is eliminating jobs or creating new ones has become a critical discussion point in 2024. As automation and machine learning continue to reshape industries, workers are facing both risks and opportunities.
This study examines the job displacement risks due to AI, the growth of AI-powered job roles, and how industries are adapting to this technological shift. Our findings are based on real-world employment trends, salary data, and AI integration across sectors.

title: AI vs. Non-AI Job Growth: Is AI Taking Over or Creating More Jobs?
section: 2 1️⃣ The State of AI-Powered Job Growth
text:
2 1️⃣ The State of AI-Powered Job Growth

2.1 1.1 AI’s Impact on Different Industries
Not all industries are affected by AI at the same rate. Here’s a comparison of AI-driven job creation vs. displacement:








Industry
Jobs Created by AI
Jobs Lost Due to AI




Tech & Data Science
AI Engineers, Data Scientists, ML Experts
Some Software Testing Roles


Finance
AI Risk Analysts, Algorithmic Traders
Bank Tellers, Loan Officers


Manufacturing
AI-Assisted Robotics Engineers
Assembly Line Workers


Retail & Customer Service
AI Chatbot Developers, E-commerce Analysts
Cashiers, Call Center Agents


Healthcare
AI Radiologists, Bioinformatics Experts
Manual Data Entry Jobs


Marketing & Advertising
AI-Powered Content Creators, SEO Analysts
Traditional Copywriters



✅ Finding: AI is not purely eliminating jobs—it is reshaping existing roles and demanding new skill sets.
